   20: -module(zip_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   24:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   25: 
   26: -export([borderline/1, atomic/1,
   27:          bad_zip/1, unzip_from_binary/1, unzip_to_binary/1,
   28:          zip_to_binary/1,
   29:          unzip_options/1, zip_options/1, list_dir_options/1, aliases/1,
   30:          zip_api/1, open_leak/1, unzip_jar/1,
   31: 	 unzip_traversal_exploit/1,
   32:          compress_control/1,
   33: 	 foldl/1,fd_leak/1,unicode/1,test_zip_dir/1,
   34:          explicit_file_info/1, mode/1,
   35:          zip64_central_headers/0, unzip64_central_headers/0,
   36:          zip64_central_headers/1, unzip64_central_headers/1,
   37:          zip64_central_directory/1,
   38:          basic_timestamp/1, extended_timestamp/1,
   39:          uid_gid/1]).
   40: 
   41: -export([zip/5, unzip/3]).
   42: 
   43: -import(proplists,[get_value/2, get_value/3]).
   44: 
   45: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   46: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   47: -include_lib("stdlib/include/zip.hrl").
   48: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   49: 
   50: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   51: 
   52: all() -> 
   53:     [borderline, atomic, bad_zip, unzip_from_binary,
   54:      unzip_to_binary, zip_to_binary, unzip_options,
   55:      zip_options, list_dir_options, aliases,
   56:      zip_api, open_leak, unzip_jar, compress_control, foldl,
   57:      unzip_traversal_exploit, fd_leak, unicode, test_zip_dir,
   58:      explicit_file_info, {group, zip_group}, {group, zip64_group}].
   59: 
   60: groups() -> 
   61:     zip_groups().
   62: 
   63: %% zip   - Use zip unix tools
   64: %% ezip  - Use erlang zip on disk
   65: %% emzip - Use erlang zip in memory
   66: -define(ZIP_MODES,[zip, ezip, emzip]).
   67: %% -define(ZIP_MODES,[emzip]).
   68: -define(UNZIP_MODES,[unzip, unezip, unemzip]).
   69: %% How much memory the zip/unzip 64 testcases that zip/unzip from/to are expected to use
   70: -define(EMZIP64_MEM_USAGE, (8 * (1 bsl 30))).
   71: 
   72: zip_groups() ->
   73: 
   74:     ZipGroup=
   75:         [{zip_group,[],[{group,ZipMode} || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES]}] ++
   76:         [{ZipMode, [], [{group,UnZipMode} || UnZipMode <- ?UNZIP_MODES]}
   77:          || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES] ++
   78:         [{G, [parallel], zip_testcases()} || G <- ?UNZIP_MODES],
   79: 
   80:     Zip64Group = [{zip64_group,[],[{group,z64(ZipMode)} || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES]}] ++
   81:         [{z64(ZipMode), [sequence], [zip64_central_headers]++
   82:               [{group,z64(UnZipMode)} || UnZipMode <- ?UNZIP_MODES]}
   83:          || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES] ++
   84:         [{z64(G), [], zip64_testcases()} || G <- ?UNZIP_MODES],
   85: 
   86:     ZipGroup ++ Zip64Group.
   87: 
   88: z64(Mode) when is_atom(Mode) ->
   89:     list_to_atom(lists:concat([z64_,Mode]));
   90: z64(Modes) when is_list(Modes) ->
   91:     [z64(M) || M <- Modes].
   92: 
   93: un_z64(Mode) ->
   94:     case atom_to_list(Mode) of
   95:         "z64_" ++ ModeString -> list_to_atom(ModeString);
   96:         _ -> Mode
   97:     end.
   98: 
   99: zip_testcases() ->
  100:     [mode, basic_timestamp, extended_timestamp, uid_gid].
  101: 
  102: zip64_testcases() ->
  103:     [unzip64_central_headers,
  104:      zip64_central_directory].
  105: 
  106: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  107:     {ok, Started} = application:ensure_all_started(os_mon),
  108:     cleanup_priv_dir(Config),
  109:     [{started, Started} | Config].
  110: 
  111: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  112:     [application:stop(App) || App <- lists:reverse(get_value(started, Config))],
  113:     cleanup_priv_dir(Config),
  114:     ok.
  115: 
  116: cleanup_priv_dir(Config) ->
  117:     %% Cleanup potential files in priv_dir
  118:     Pdir = get_value(pdir, Config, get_value(priv_dir,Config)),
  119:     ct:log("Cleaning up ~s",[Pdir]),
  120:     [ case file:delete(File) of
  121:         {error, eperm} -> file:del_dir_r(File);
  122:         _ -> ok
  123:     end || File <- filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Pdir, "*"))].
  124: 
  125: init_per_group(zip64_group, Config) ->
  126:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  127: 
  128:     SkipZip64 = string:find(os:getenv("TS_EXTRA_PLATFORM_LABEL",""), "Docker") =/= nomatch,
  129:     WordSize = erlang:system_info(wordsize),
  130:     DiskFreeKB = disc_free(PrivDir),
  131:     MemFreeB = memsize(),
  132: 
  133:     if SkipZip64 ->
  134:             {skip, "Zip64 tests unstable on docker, do not run"};
  135:        WordSize =:= 4 ->
  136:             {skip, "Zip64 tests only work on 64-bit systems"};
  137:        DiskFreeKB =:= error ->
  138:             {skip, "Failed to query disk space for priv_dir. "
  139:              "Is it on a remote file system?~n"};
  140:        DiskFreeKB >= 16 * (1 bsl 20), MemFreeB >= ?EMZIP64_MEM_USAGE ->
  141:             ct:log("Free disk: ~w KByte~n", [DiskFreeKB]),
  142:             ct:log("Free memory: ~w MByte~n", [MemFreeB div (1 bsl 20)]),
  143:             OneMB = <<0:(8 bsl 20)>>,
  144:             Large4GB = filename:join(PrivDir, "large.txt"),
  145:             ok = file:write_file(Large4GB, lists:duplicate(4 bsl 10, OneMB)),
  146:             Medium4MB = filename:join(PrivDir, "medium.txt"),
  147:             ok = file:write_file(Medium4MB, lists:duplicate(4, OneMB)),
  148: 
  149:             [{large, Large4GB},{medium,Medium4MB}|Config];
  150:         true ->
  151:             ct:log("Free disk: ~w KByte~n", [DiskFreeKB]),
  152:             ct:log("Free memory: ~w MByte~n", [MemFreeB div (1 bsl 20)]),
  153:             {skip,"Less than 16 GByte free disk or less then 8 GB free mem"}
  154:     end;
  155: init_per_group(Group, Config) ->
  156:     case lists:member(Group, ?ZIP_MODES ++ ?UNZIP_MODES ++ z64(?ZIP_MODES ++ ?UNZIP_MODES)) of
  157:         true ->
  158:             case get_value(zip, Config) of
  159:                 undefined ->
  160:                     case un_z64(Group) =/= zip orelse has_zip() of
  161:                         true ->
  162:                             Pdir = filename:join(get_value(priv_dir, Config),Group),
  163:                             ok = filelib:ensure_path(Pdir),
  164:                             [{pdir, Pdir},{zip, Group} | Config];
  165:                         false ->
  166:                             {skip, "No zip program found"}
  167:                     end;
  168:                 _Zip ->
  169:                     case un_z64(Group) =/= unzip orelse has_zip() of
  170:                         true ->
  171:                             Pdir = filename:join(get_value(pdir, Config),Group),
  172:                             ok = filelib:ensure_path(Pdir),
  173:                             [{pdir, Pdir},{unzip, Group} | Config];
  174:                         false ->
  175:                             {skip, "No zip program found"}
  176:                     end
  177:             end;
  178:         false ->
  179:             Config
  180:     end.
  181: 
  182: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  183:     cleanup_priv_dir(Config),
  184:     Config.
  185: 
  186: init_per_testcase(TC, Config) ->
  187:     UsesZip = un_z64(get_value(zip, Config)) =:= zip orelse un_z64(get_value(unzip, Config)) =:= unzip,
  188:     HasZip = has_zip(),
  189:     ct:log("Free memory: ~w MByte~n", [memsize() div (1 bsl 20)]),
  190:     if UsesZip andalso not HasZip ->
  191:             {skip, "No zip command found"};
  192:        true ->
  193:             PrivDir = filename:join(get_value(pdir, Config,get_value(priv_dir, Config)), TC),
  194:             ok = filelib:ensure_path(PrivDir),
  195:             [{pdir, PrivDir} | Config]
  196:     end.
  197: 
  198: 
  199: end_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
  200:     cleanup_priv_dir(Config),
  201:     Config.
  202: 
  203: %% Test creating, listing and extracting one file from an archive
  204: %% multiple times with different file sizes. Also check that the
  205: %% modification date of the extracted file has survived.
  206: borderline(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  207:     RootDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  208:     TempDir = filename:join(RootDir, "borderline"),
  209: 
  210:     Record = 512,
  211:     Block = 20 * Record,
  212: 
  213:     lists:foreach(fun(Size) -> borderline_test(Size, TempDir) end,
  214:                   [0, 1, 10, 13, 127, 333, Record-1, Record, Record+1,
  215:                    Block-Record-1, Block-Record, Block-Record+1,
  216:                    Block-1, Block, Block+1,
  217:                    Block+Record-1, Block+Record, Block+Record+1]),
  218: 
  219:     %% Clean up.
  220:     delete_files([TempDir]),
  221:     ok.
  222: 
  223: borderline_test(Size, TempDir) ->
  224:     Archive = filename:join(TempDir, "ar_"++integer_to_list(Size)++".zip"),
  225:     Name = filename:join(TempDir, "file_"++integer_to_list(Size)),
  226:     io:format("Testing size ~p", [Size]),
  227: 
  228:     %% Create a file and archive it.
  229:     {_, _, X0} = erlang:timestamp(),
  230:     file:write_file(Name, random_byte_list(X0, Size)),
  231:     {ok, Archive} = zip:zip(Archive, [Name]),
  232:     ok = file:delete(Name),
  233: 
  234:     %% Verify listing and extracting.
  235:     {ok, [#zip_comment{comment = []},
  236:           #zip_file{name = Name,
  237:                     info = Info,
  238:                     offset = 0,
  239:                     comp_size = _}]} = zip:list_dir(Archive),
  240:     Size = Info#file_info.size,
  241:     {ok, [Name]} = zip:extract(Archive, [verbose]),
  242: 
  243:     %% Verify contents of extracted file.
  244:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(Name),
  245:     true = match_byte_list(X0, binary_to_list(Bin)),
  246: 
  247: 
  248:     %% Verify that Unix zip can read it. (if we have a unix zip that is!)
  249:     zipinfo_match(Archive, Name),
  250: 
  251:     ok.
  252: 
  253: zipinfo_match(Archive, Name) ->
  254:     case check_zipinfo_exists() of
  255:         true ->
  256:             Encoding = file:native_name_encoding(),
  257:             Expect = unicode:characters_to_binary(Name ++ "\n",
  258:                                                   Encoding, Encoding),
  259:             cmd_expect("zipinfo -1 " ++ Archive, Expect);
  260:         _ ->
  261:             ok
  262:     end.
  263: 
  264: check_zipinfo_exists() ->
  265:     is_list(os:find_executable("zipinfo")).
  266: 
  267: cmd_expect(Cmd, Expect) ->
  268:     Port = open_port({spawn, make_cmd(Cmd)}, [stream, in, binary, eof]),
  269:     get_data(Port, Expect, <<>>).
  270: 
  271: get_data(Port, Expect, Acc) ->
  272:     receive
  273:         {Port, {data, Bytes}} ->
  274:             get_data(Port, Expect, <<Acc/binary, Bytes/binary>>);
  275:         {Port, eof} ->
  276:             Port ! {self(), close},
  277:             receive
  278:                 {Port, closed} ->
  279:                     true
  280:             end,
  281:             receive
  282:                 {'EXIT',  Port,  _} ->
  283:                     ok
  284:             after 1 ->                          % force context switch
  285:                     ok
  286:             end,
  287:             match_output(Acc, Expect, Port)
  288:     end.
  289: 
  290: match_output(<<C, Output/bits>>, <<C,Expect/bits>>, Port) ->
  291:     match_output(Output, Expect, Port);
  292: match_output(<<_, _/bits>>, <<_, _/bits>>, Port) ->
  293:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, badmatch);
  294: match_output(<<_, _/bits>>=Rest, <<>>, Port) ->
  295:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, {too_much_data, Rest});
  296: match_output(<<>>, <<>>, _Port) ->
  297:     ok.
  298: 
  299: kill_port_and_fail(Port, Reason) ->
  300:     unlink(Port),
  301:     exit(Port, die),
  302:     ct:fail(Reason).
  303: 
  304: make_cmd(Cmd) ->
  305:     Cmd.
  306: %%     case os:type() of
  307: %%      {win32, _} -> lists:concat(["cmd /c",  Cmd]);
  308: %%      {unix, _}  -> lists:concat(["sh -c '",  Cmd,  "'"])
  309: %%     end.
  310: 
  311: %% Verifies a random byte list.
  312: 
  313: match_byte_list(X0, [Byte|Rest]) ->
  314:     X = next_random(X0),
  315:     case (X bsr 26) band 16#ff of
  316:         Byte -> match_byte_list(X, Rest);
  317:         _ -> false
  318:     end;
  319: match_byte_list(_, []) ->
  320:     true.
  321: 
  322: %% Generates a random byte list.
  323: 
  324: random_byte_list(X0, Count) ->
  325:     random_byte_list(X0, Count, []).
  326: 
  327: random_byte_list(X0, Count, Result) when Count > 0->
  328:     X = next_random(X0),
  329:     random_byte_list(X, Count-1, [(X bsr 26) band 16#ff|Result]);
  330: random_byte_list(_X, 0, Result) ->
  331:     lists:reverse(Result).
  332: 
  333: %% This RNG is from line 21 on page 102 in Knuth: The Art of Computer Programming,
  334: %% Volume II, Seminumerical Algorithms.
  335: 
  336: next_random(X) ->
  337:     (X*17059465+1) band 16#fffffffff.
  338: 
  339: %% Test the 'atomic' operations: zip/unzip/list_dir, on archives.
  340: %% Also test the 'cooked' option.
  341: atomic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  342:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  343:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  344:     Names = [Name || {Name,_,_} <- DataFiles],
  345:     io:format("Names: ~p", [Names]),
  346: 
  347:     %% Create a zip  archive.
  348: 
  349:     Zip2 = "zip.zip",
  350:     {ok, Zip2} = zip:zip(Zip2, Names, []),
  351:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip2)),
  352: 
  353:     %% Same test again, but this time created with 'cooked'
  354: 
  355:     Zip3 = "cooked.zip",
  356:     {ok, Zip3} = zip:zip(Zip3, Names, [cooked]),
  357:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip3)),
  358:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip3, [cooked])),
  359: 
  360:     %% Clean up.
  361:     delete_files([Zip2,Zip3|Names]),
  362: 
  363:     ok.
  364: 
  365: %% Test the zip_open/2, zip_get/1, zip_get/2, zip_close/1,
  366: %% and zip_list_dir/1 functions.
  367: zip_api(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  368:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  369:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  370:     Names = [Name || {Name, _, _} <- DataFiles],
  371:     io:format("Names: ~p", [Names]),
  372: 
  373:     %% Create a zip archive
  374:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  375:     {ok, Zip} = zip:zip(Zip, Names, []),
  376: 
  377:     %% Open archive
  378:     {ok, ZipSrv} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  379: 
  380:     %% List dir
  381:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:zip_list_dir(ZipSrv)),
  382: 
  383:     %% Get a file
  384:     Name1 = hd(Names),
  385:     {ok, Data1} = file:read_file(Name1),
  386:     {ok, {Name1, Data1}} = zip:zip_get(Name1, ZipSrv),
  387:     Data1Crc = erlang:crc32(Data1),
  388:     {ok, Data1Crc} = zip:zip_get_crc32(Name1, ZipSrv),
  389: 
  390:     %% Get all files
  391:     FilesDatas = lists:map(fun(Name) -> {ok, B} = file:read_file(Name),
  392:                                         {Name, B} end, Names),
  393:     {ok, FilesDatas} = zip:zip_get(ZipSrv),
  394: 
  395:     %% Close
  396:     ok = zip:zip_close(ZipSrv),
  397: 
  398:     %% Clean up.
  399:     delete_files([Names]),
  400: 
  401:     ok.
  402: 
  403: %% Test that zip doesn't leak processes and ports where the
  404: %% controlling process dies without closing an zip opened with
  405: %% zip:zip_open/1.
  406: open_leak(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  407:     %% Create a zip archive
  408:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  409:     {ok, Zip} = zip:zip(Zip, [], []),
  410: 
  411:     %% Open archive in a another process that dies immediately.
  412:     ZipSrv = spawn_zip(Zip, [memory]),
  413: 
  414:     %% Expect the ZipSrv process to die soon after.
  415:     true = spawned_zip_dead(ZipSrv),
  416: 
  417:     %% Clean up.
  418:     delete_files([Zip]),
  419: 
  420:     ok.
  421: 
  422: spawn_zip(Zip, Options) ->
  423:     Self = self(),
  424:     spawn(fun() -> Self ! zip:zip_open(Zip, Options) end),
  425:     receive
  426:         {ok, ZipSrv} ->
  427:             ZipSrv
  428:     end.
  429: 
  430: spawned_zip_dead(ZipSrv) ->
  431:     Ref = monitor(process, ZipSrv),
  432:     receive
  433:         {'DOWN', Ref, _, ZipSrv, _} ->
  434:             true
  435:     after 1000 ->
  436:             false
  437:     end.
  438: 
  439: %% Test options for unzip, only cwd and file_list currently.
  440: unzip_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  441:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  442:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  443:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  444: 
  445:     %% create a temp directory
  446:     Subdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "t"),
  447:     ok = file:make_dir(Subdir),
  448: 
  449:     FList = ["quotes/rain.txt","wikipedia.txt"],
  450: 
  451:     %% Unzip a zip file in Subdir
  452:     {ok, RetList} = zip:unzip(Long, [{cwd, Subdir},
  453: 				     {file_list, FList}]),
  454: 
  455:     %% Verify.
  456:     true = (length(FList) =:= length(RetList)),
  457:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  458: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  459: 		  FList),
  460:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> ok = file:delete(F) end,
  461: 		  RetList),
  462: 
  463:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  464:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  465: 
  466:     FList2 = ["abc.txt","quotes/rain.txt","wikipedia.txt","emptyFile"],
  467: 
  468:     %% Unzip a zip file in Subdir
  469:     {ok, RetList2} = zip:unzip(Long, [{cwd, Subdir},skip_directories]),
  470: 
  471:     %% Verify.
  472:     true = (length(RetList2) =:= 4),
  473:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  474: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  475: 		  FList2),
  476:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> 1 = delete_files([F]) end,
  477: 		  RetList2),
  478: 
  479:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  480:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  481:     ok.
  482: 
  483: %% Test that unzip handles directory traversal exploit (OTP-13633)
  484: unzip_traversal_exploit(Config) ->
  485:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  486:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  487:     ZipName = filename:join(DataDir, "exploit.zip"),
  488: 
  489:     %% $ zipinfo -1 test/zip_SUITE_data/exploit.zip 
  490:     %% clash.txt
  491:     %% ../clash.txt
  492:     %% ../above.txt
  493:     %% subdir/../in_root_dir.txt
  494: 
  495:     %% create a temp directory
  496:     SubDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "exploit_test"),
  497:     ok = file:make_dir(SubDir),
  498:     
  499:     ClashFile = filename:join(SubDir,"clash.txt"),
  500:     AboveFile = filename:join(SubDir,"above.txt"),
  501:     RelativePathFile = filename:join(SubDir,"subdir/../in_root_dir.txt"),
  502: 
  503:     %% unzip in SubDir
  504:     {ok, [ClashFile, ClashFile, AboveFile, RelativePathFile]} =
  505: 	zip:unzip(ZipName, [{cwd,SubDir}]),
  506: 
  507:     {ok,<<"This file will overwrite other file.\n">>} =
  508: 	file:read_file(ClashFile),
  509:     {ok,_} = file:read_file(AboveFile),
  510:     {ok,_} = file:read_file(RelativePathFile),
  511: 
  512:     %% clean up
  513:     delete_files([SubDir]),
  514:     
  515:      %% create the temp directory again
  516:     ok = file:make_dir(SubDir),
  517: 
  518:     %% unzip in SubDir
  519:     {ok, [ClashFile, AboveFile, RelativePathFile]} =
  520: 	zip:unzip(ZipName, [{cwd,SubDir},keep_old_files]),
  521: 
  522:     {ok,<<"This is the original file.\n">>} =
  523: 	file:read_file(ClashFile),
  524:    
  525:     %% clean up
  526:     delete_files([SubDir]),
  527:     ok.
  528: 
  529: %% Test unzip a jar file (OTP-7382).
  530: unzip_jar(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  531:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  532:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  533:     JarFile = filename:join(DataDir, "test.jar"),
  534: 
  535:     %% create a temp directory
  536:     Subdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "jartest"),
  537:     ok = file:make_dir(Subdir),
  538: 
  539:     FList = ["META-INF/MANIFEST.MF","test.txt"],
  540: 
  541:     {ok, RetList} = zip:unzip(JarFile, [{cwd, Subdir}]),
  542: 
  543:     %% Verify.
  544:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  545: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  546: 		  FList),
  547:     lists:foreach(fun(F)->
  548:                           case lists:last(F) =:= $/ of
  549:                               true -> ok = file:del_dir(F);
  550:                               false -> ok = file:delete(F)
  551:                           end
  552:                   end,
  553: 		  lists:reverse(RetList)),
  554: 
  555:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  556:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  557:     ok.
  558: 
  559: %% Test the options for unzip, only cwd currently.
  560: zip_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  561:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  562:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  563:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  564:     Names = [Name || {Name, _, _} <- DataFiles],
  565: 
  566:     %% Make sure cwd is not where we get the files
  567:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(data_dir, Config)),
  568: 
  569:     %% Create a zip archive
  570:     {ok, {_,Zip}} =
  571:         zip:zip("filename_not_used.zip", Names, [memory, {cwd, PrivDir}]),
  572: 
  573:     %% Open archive
  574:     {ok, ZipSrv} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  575: 
  576:     %% List dir
  577:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:zip_list_dir(ZipSrv)),
  578: 
  579:     %% Get a file
  580:     Name1 = hd(Names),
  581:     {ok, Data1} = file:read_file(filename:join(PrivDir, Name1)),
  582:     {ok, {Name1, Data1}} = zip:zip_get(Name1, ZipSrv),
  583: 
  584:     %% Get all files
  585:     FilesDatas = lists:map(fun(Name) -> {ok, B} = file:read_file(filename:join(PrivDir, Name)),
  586:                                         {Name, B} end, Names),
  587:     {ok, FilesDatas} = zip:zip_get(ZipSrv),
  588: 
  589:     %% Close
  590:     ok = zip:zip_close(ZipSrv),
  591: 
  592:     %% Clean up.
  593:     delete_files([Names]),
  594: 
  595:     ok.
  596: 
  597: %% Test the options for list_dir... one day.
  598: list_dir_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  599: 
  600:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  601:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  602: 
  603:     {ok,
  604:      ["abc.txt", "quotes/rain.txt", "empty/", "wikipedia.txt", "emptyFile" ]} =
  605:         zip:list_dir(Archive,[names_only]),
  606: 
  607:     {ok,
  608:      [#zip_comment{},
  609:       #zip_file{ name = "abc.txt" },
  610:       #zip_file{ name = "quotes/rain.txt" },
  611:       #zip_file{ name = "wikipedia.txt" },
  612:       #zip_file{ name = "emptyFile" }
  613:      ]} =  zip:list_dir(Archive,[skip_directories]),
  614: 
  615:     ok.
  616: 
  617: %% convert zip_info as returned from list_dir to a list of names
  618: names_from_list_dir({ok, Info}) ->
  619:     names_from_list_dir(Info);
  620: names_from_list_dir(Info) ->
  621:     tl(lists:map(fun(#zip_file{name = Name}) -> Name;
  622:                     (_) -> ok end, Info)).
  623: 
  624: %% Returns a sequence of characters.
  625: char_seq(N, First) ->
  626:     char_seq(N, First, []).
  627: 
  628: char_seq(0, _, Result) ->
  629:     Result;
  630: char_seq(N, C, Result) when C < 127 ->
  631:     char_seq(N-1, C+1, [C|Result]);
  632: char_seq(N, _, Result) ->
  633:     char_seq(N, $!, Result).
  634: 
  635: data_files() ->
  636:     Files = [{"first_file", 1555, $a},
  637:              {"small_file", 7, $d},
  638:              {"big_file", 23875, $e},
  639:              {"last_file", 7500, $g}],
  640:     create_files(Files),
  641:     Files.
  642: 
  643: create_files([{Name, dir, _First}|Rest]) ->
  644:     ok = file:make_dir(Name),
  645:     create_files(Rest);
  646: create_files([{Name, Size, First}|Rest]) when is_integer(Size) ->
  647:     ok = file:write_file(Name, char_seq(Size, First)),
  648:     create_files(Rest);
  649: create_files([]) ->
  650:     ok.
  651:

  656: %%     Name = filename:join(Parent, Dir),

  658: %%     make_dirs(Rest, Name);

  660: %%     Dir.

  662: %% Try zip:unzip/1 on some corrupted zip files.
  663: bad_zip(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  664:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  665:     try_bad("bad_crc",    {bad_crc, "abc.txt"}, Config),
  666:     try_bad("bad_central_directory", bad_central_directory, Config),
  667:     try_bad("bad_file_header",    bad_file_header, Config),
  668:     try_bad("bad_eocd",    bad_eocd, Config),
  669:     try_bad("enoent", enoent, Config),
  670:     GetNotFound = fun(A) ->
  671:                           {ok, O} = zip:zip_open(A, []),
  672:                           zip:zip_get("not_here", O)
  673:                   end,
  674:     try_bad("abc", file_not_found, GetNotFound, Config),
  675:     ok.
  676: 
  677: try_bad(N, R, Config) ->
  678:     try_bad(N, R, fun(A) -> io:format("name : ~p\n", [A]),
  679:                             zip:unzip(A, [verbose]) end, Config).
  680: 
  681: try_bad(Name0, Reason, What, Config) ->
  682:     %% Intentionally no macros here.
  683: 
  684:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  685:     Name = Name0 ++ ".zip",
  686:     io:format("~nTrying ~s", [Name]),
  687:     Full = filename:join(DataDir, Name),
  688:     Expected = {error, Reason},
  689:     case What(Full) of
  690:         Expected ->
  691:             io:format("Result: ~p\n", [Expected]);
  692:         Other ->
  693:             io:format("unzip/2 returned ~p (expected ~p)\n", [Other, Expected]),
  694:             ct:fail({bad_return_value, Other})
  695:     end.
  696:

  713:                           Filename = filename:join(DataDir, F),

  715:                               true ->

  809:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(DestQuote),

  822:         = zip:unzip(Bin, [skip_directories]),
  823: 
  824:     %% Verify.
  825:     DestFilename = filename:join(ExtractDir, "abc.txt"),
  826:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, FileName)),
  827:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(DestFilename),
  828: 
  829:     DestQuote = filename:join([ExtractDir, "quotes", "rain.txt"]),
  830:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, Quote)),
  831:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(DestQuote),
  832: 
  833:     %% Clean up.
  834:     delete_files([DestFilename, DestQuote, ExtractDir]),
  835:

  838: %% oac_files() ->
  839: %%     Files = [{"oac_file", 1459, $x},
  840: %%           {"oac_small", 99, $w},
  841: %%           {"oac_big", 33896, $A}],
  842: %%     create_files(Files),
  843: %%     Files.
  844: 
  845: %% Delete the given list of files and directories.
  846: %% Return total number of deleted files (not directories)
  847: delete_files(List) ->
  848:     do_delete_files(List, 0).
  849: do_delete_files([],Cnt) ->
  850:     Cnt;
  851: do_delete_files([Item|Rest], Cnt) ->
  852:     case file:delete(Item) of
  853:         ok ->
  854:             DelCnt = 1;
  855:         {error,eperm} ->
  856:             file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  857:             DelCnt = delete_files(filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Item, "*"))),
  858:             file:del_dir(Item);
  859:         {error,eacces} ->
  860:             %% We'll see about that!
  861:             file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  862:             case file:delete(Item) of
  863:                 ok ->
  864: 		    DelCnt = 1;
  865:                 {error,_} ->
  866:                     erlang:yield(),
  867:                     file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  868:                     file:delete(Item),
  869:                     DelCnt = 1
  870:             end;
  871:         {error,_} ->
  872:             DelCnt = 0
  873:     end,
  874:     do_delete_files(Rest, Cnt + DelCnt).
  875: 
  876: %% Test control of which files that should be compressed.
  877: compress_control(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  878:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  879:     Dir = "compress_control",
  880:     Files = [
  881:              {Dir,                                                          dir,   $d},
  882:              {filename:join([Dir, "first_file.txt"]), 10000, $f},
  883:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir"]), dir,   $d},
  884:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "zzz.zip"]), 10000, $z},
  885:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "lll.lzh"]), 10000, $l},
  886:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "eee.exe"]), 10000, $e},
  887:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "ggg.arj"]), 10000, $g},
  888:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "b_dir"]), dir,   $d},
  889:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "b_dir", "ggg.arj"]), 10000, $a},
  890:              {filename:join([Dir, "last_file.txt"]), 10000, $l}
  891:             ],
  892: 
  893:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  894: 			  Files,
  895: 			  [{compress, []}],
  896: 			  []),
  897: 
  898:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  899: 			  Files,
  900: 			  [{uncompress, all}],
  901: 			  []),
  902: 
  903:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  904: 			  Files,
  905: 			  [{uncompress, []}],
  906: 			  [".txt", ".exe", ".zip", ".lzh", ".arj"]),
  907: 
  908:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  909: 			  Files,
  910: 			  [],
  911: 			  [".txt", ".exe"]),
  912: 
  913:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  914: 			  Files,
  915: 			  [{uncompress, {add, [".exe"]}},
  916: 			   {uncompress, {del, [".zip", "arj"]}}],
  917: 			  [".txt", ".zip", "arj"]),
  918: 
  919:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  920: 			  Files,
  921: 			  [{uncompress, []},
  922: 			   {uncompress, {add, [".exe"]}},
  923: 			   {uncompress, {del, [".zip", "arj"]}}],
  924: 			  [".txt", ".zip", ".lzh", ".arj"]),
  925: 
  926:     ok.
  927: 
  928: test_compress_control(Dir, Files, ZipOptions, Expected) ->
  929:     %% Cleanup
  930:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  931:     Names = [N || {N, _, _} <- Files],
  932:     delete_files([Zip]),
  933:     delete_files(lists:reverse(Names)),
  934: 
  935:     create_files(Files),
  936:     {ok, Zip} = zip:create(Zip, [Dir], ZipOptions),
  937: 
  938:     {ok, OpenZip} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  939:     {ok,[#zip_comment{comment = ""} | ZipList]} = zip:zip_list_dir(OpenZip),
  940:     io:format("compress_control:  -> ~p  -> ~p\n  -> ~pn", [Expected, ZipOptions, ZipList]),
  941:     verify_compression(Files, ZipList, OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected),
  942:     ok = zip:zip_close(OpenZip),
  943: 
  944:     %% Cleanup
  945:     delete_files([Zip]),
  946:     delete_files(lists:reverse(Names)), % Remove plain files before directories
  947: 
  948:     ok.
  949: 
  950: verify_compression([{Name, Kind, _Filler} | Files], ZipList, OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected) ->
  951:     {Name2, BinSz} =
  952:         case Kind of
  953:             dir ->
  954:                 {Name ++ "/", 0};
  955:             _   ->
  956:                 {ok, {Name, Bin}} = zip:zip_get(Name, OpenZip),
  957:                 {Name, size(Bin)}
  958:         end,
  959:     {Name2, {value, ZipFile}} = {Name2, lists:keysearch(Name2,  #zip_file.name, ZipList)},
  960:     #zip_file{info = #file_info{size = InfoSz, type = InfoType}, comp_size = InfoCompSz} = ZipFile,
  961: 
  962:     Ext = filename:extension(Name),
  963:     IsComp = is_compressed(Ext, Kind, ZipOptions),
  964:     ExpComp = lists:member(Ext, Expected),
  965:     case {Name, Kind, InfoType, IsComp, ExpComp, BinSz, InfoSz, InfoCompSz} of
  966:         {_, dir, directory, false, _,     Sz, Sz, Sz}      when Sz =:= BinSz -> ok;
  967:         {_, Sz,  regular,   false, false, Sz, Sz, Sz}      when Sz =:= BinSz -> ok;
  968:         {_, Sz,  regular,   true,  true,  Sz, Sz, OtherSz} when Sz =:= BinSz, OtherSz =/= BinSz -> ok
  969:     end,
  970:     verify_compression(Files, ZipList -- [ZipFile], OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected);
  971: verify_compression([], [], _OpenZip, _ZipOptions, _Expected) ->
  972:     ok.
  973: 
  974: is_compressed(_Ext, dir, _Options) ->
  975:     false;
  976: is_compressed(Ext, _Sz, Options) ->
  977:     CompressOpt =
  978:         case [What || {compress, What} <- Options] of
  979:             [] -> all;
  980:             CompressOpts-> extensions(CompressOpts, all)
  981:         end,
  982:     DoCompress = (CompressOpt =:= all) orelse lists:member(Ext, CompressOpt),
  983:     Default = [".Z", ".zip", ".zoo", ".arc", ".lzh", ".arj"],
  984:     UncompressOpt =
  985:         case [What || {uncompress, What} <- Options] of
  986:             [] -> Default;
  987:             UncompressOpts-> extensions(UncompressOpts, Default)
  988:         end,
  989:     DoUncompress = (UncompressOpt =:= all) orelse lists:member(Ext, UncompressOpt),
  990:     DoCompress andalso not DoUncompress.
  991: 
  992: extensions([H | T], Old) ->
  993:     case H of
  994:         all ->
  995:             extensions(T, H);
  996:         H when is_list(H) ->
  997:             extensions(T, H);
  998:         {add, New} when is_list(New), is_list(Old) ->
  999:             extensions(T, Old ++ New);
 1000:         {del, New} when is_list(New), is_list(Old) ->
 1001:             extensions(T, Old -- New);
 1002:         _ ->
 1003:             extensions(T, Old)
 1004:     end;
 1005: extensions([], Old) ->
 1006:     Old.
 1007: 
 1008: foldl(Config) ->
 1009:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1010:     File = filename:join([PrivDir, "foldl.zip"]),
 1011: 
 1012:     FooBin = <<"FOO">>,
 1013:     BarBin = <<"BAR">>,
 1014:     Files = [{"foo", FooBin}, {"bar", BarBin}],
 1015:     {ok, {File, Bin}} = zip:create(File, Files, [memory,{extra,[]}]),
 1016:     ZipFun = fun(N, I, B, Acc) -> [{N, B(), I()} | Acc] end,
 1017:     {ok, FileSpec} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], {File, Bin}),
 1018:     [{"bar", BarBin, #file_info{}}, {"foo", FooBin, #file_info{}}] = FileSpec,
 1019:     {ok, {File, Bin}} = zip:create(File, lists:reverse(FileSpec), [memory,{extra,[]}]),
 1020:     {foo_bin, FooBin} =
 1021: 	try
 1022: 	    zip:foldl(fun("foo", _, B, _) -> throw(B()); (_, _, _, Acc) -> Acc end, [], {File, Bin})
 1023: 	catch
 1024: 	    throw:FooBin ->
 1025: 		{foo_bin, FooBin}
 1026: 	end,
 1027:     ok = file:write_file(File, Bin),
 1028:     {ok, FileSpec} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], File),
 1029: 
 1030:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(fun() -> ok end, [], File),
 1031:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], 42),
 1032:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], {File, 42}),
 1033: 
 1034:     ok = file:delete(File),
 1035:     {error, enoent} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], File),
 1036: 
 1037:     ok.
 1038: 
 1039: fd_leak(Config) ->
 1040:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
 1041:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1042:     Name = filename:join(DataDir, "bad_file_header.zip"),
 1043:     BadExtract = fun() ->
 1044:                          {error,bad_file_header} = zip:extract(Name),
 1045:                          ok
 1046:                  end,
 1047:     do_fd_leak(BadExtract, 1),
 1048: 
 1049:     BadCreate = fun() ->
 1050:                         {error,enoent} = zip:zip("failed.zip",
 1051:                                                  ["none"]),
 1052:                         ok
 1053:                 end,
 1054:     do_fd_leak(BadCreate, 1),
 1055: 
 1056:     ok.
 1057: 
 1058: do_fd_leak(_Bad, 10000) ->
 1059:     ok;
 1060: do_fd_leak(Bad, N) ->
 1061:     try Bad() of
 1062:         ok ->
 1063:             do_fd_leak(Bad, N + 1)
 1064:     catch
 1065:         C:R:Stk ->
 1066:             io:format("Bad error after ~p attempts\n", [N]),
 1067:             erlang:raise(C, R, Stk)
 1068:     end.
 1069: 
 1070: unicode(Config) ->
 1071:     case file:native_name_encoding() of
 1072:         latin1 ->
 1073:             {comment, "Native name encoding is Latin-1; skipping all tests"};
 1074:         utf8 ->
 1075:             DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1076:             ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
 1077:             test_file_comment(DataDir),
 1078:             test_archive_comment(DataDir),
 1079:             test_bad_comment(DataDir),
 1080:             test_latin1_archive(DataDir),
 1081:             case has_zip() of
 1082:                 false ->
 1083:                     {comment, "No zip program found; skipping some tests"};
 1084:                 true ->
 1085:                     case zip_is_unicode_aware() of
 1086:                         true ->
 1087:                             test_filename_compatibility(),
 1088:                             ok;
 1089:                         false ->
 1090:                             {comment, "Old zip program; skipping some tests"}
 1091:                     end
 1092:             end
 1093:     end.
 1094: 
 1095: test_filename_compatibility() ->
 1096:     FancyName = "d",
 1097:     Archive = "test.zip",
 1098: 
 1099:     {ok, Archive} = zip:zip(Archive, [{FancyName, <<"test">>}]),
 1100:     zipinfo_match(Archive, FancyName).
 1101: 
 1102: test_file_comment(DataDir) ->
 1103:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_file_comment.zip"),
 1104:     Comments = ["a", [246], [1024]],
 1105:     FileNames = [[C] ++ ".txt" || C <- [$a, 246, 1024]],
 1106:     [begin
 1107:          test_zip_file(FileName, Comment, Archive),
 1108:          test_file_comment(FileName, Comment, Archive)
 1109:      end ||
 1110:         Comment <- Comments, FileName <- FileNames],
 1111:     ok.
 1112: 
 1113: test_zip_file(FileName, Comment, Archive) ->
 1114:     _ = file:delete(Archive),
 1115:     io:format("*** zip:zip(). Testing FileName ~ts, Comment ~ts\n",
 1116:               [FileName, Comment]),
 1117:     ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
 1118:     {ok, Archive} =
 1119:         zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]),
 1120:     zip_check(Archive, Comment, FileName, "").
 1121: 
 1122: test_file_comment(FileName, Comment, Archive) ->
 1123:     case test_zip1() of
 1124:         false ->
 1125:             ok;
 1126:         true ->
 1127:             _ = file:delete(Archive),
 1128:             io:format("*** zip(1). Testing FileName ~ts, Comment ~ts\n",
 1129:                       [FileName, Comment]),
 1130:             ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
 1131:             R = os:cmd("echo " ++ Comment ++ "| zip -c " ++
 1132:                            Archive ++ " " ++ FileName),
 1133:             io:format("os:cmd/1 returns ~lp\n", [R]),
 1134:             zip_check(Archive, "", FileName, Comment)
 1135:     end.
 1136: 
 1137: test_archive_comment(DataDir) ->
 1138:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_archive_comment.zip"),
 1139:     Chars = [$a, 246, 1024],
 1140:     [test_archive_comment(Char, Archive) || Char <- Chars],
 1141:     ok.
 1142: 
 1143: test_archive_comment(Char, Archive) ->
 1144:     case test_zip1() of
 1145:         false ->
 1146:             ok;
 1147:         true ->
 1148:             _ = file:delete(Archive),
 1149:             FileName = "a.txt",
 1150:             Comment = [Char],
 1151:             io:format("*** Testing archive Comment ~ts\n", [Comment]),
 1152:             ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
 1153: 
 1154:             {ok, _} =
 1155:                 zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]),
 1156:             Res = os:cmd("zip -z " ++ Archive),
 1157:             io:format("os:cmd/1 returns ~lp\n", [Res]),
 1158:             true = lists:member(Char, Res),
 1159: 
 1160:             os:cmd("echo " ++ Comment ++ "| zip -z "++
 1161:                        Archive ++ " " ++ FileName),
 1162:             zip_check(Archive, Comment, FileName, "")
 1163:     end.
 1164: 
 1165: test_zip1() ->
 1166:     has_zip() andalso zip_is_unicode_aware().
 1167: 
 1168: has_zip() ->
 1169:     os:find_executable("zip") =/= false andalso element(1, os:type()) =:= unix.
 1170: 
 1171: zip_is_unicode_aware() ->
 1172:     S = os:cmd("zip -v | grep 'UNICODE_SUPPORT'"),
 1173:     string:find(S, "UNICODE_SUPPORT") =/= nomatch.
 1174: 
 1175: zip_check(Archive, ArchiveComment, FileName, FileNameComment) ->
 1176:     {ok, CommentAndFiles} = zip:table(Archive),
 1177:     io:format("zip:table/1 returns\n  ~lp\n", [CommentAndFiles]),
 1178:     io:format("checking archive comment ~lp\n", [ArchiveComment]),
 1179:     [_] = [C || #zip_comment{comment = C} <- CommentAndFiles,
 1180:                 C =:= ArchiveComment],
 1181:     io:format("checking filename ~lp\n", [FileName]),
 1182:     io:format("and filename comment ~lp\n", [FileNameComment]),
 1183:     [_] = [F || #zip_file{name = F, comment = C} <- CommentAndFiles,
 1184:                 F =:= FileName, C =:= FileNameComment],
 1185:     {ok, FileList} = zip:unzip(Archive, [verbose]),
 1186:     io:format("zip:unzip/2 returns\n  ~lp\n", [FileList]),
 1187:     true = lists:member(FileName, FileList),
 1188:     ok.
 1189: 
 1190: test_bad_comment(DataDir) ->
 1191:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_bad_comment.zip"),
 1192:     FileName = "a.txt",
 1193:     file:write_file(FileName, ["something"]),
 1194:     Comment = [9999999],
 1195:     {error,{bad_unicode,Comment}} =
 1196:         zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]).
 1197: 
 1198: test_latin1_archive(DataDir) ->
 1199:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip-latin1.zip"),
 1200:     FileName = [246] ++ ".txt",
 1201:     ArchiveComment = [246],
 1202:     zip_check(Archive, ArchiveComment, FileName, "").
 1203: 
 1204: test_zip_dir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1205:     case {os:find_executable("unzip"), os:type()} of
 1206:         {UnzipPath, {unix,_}} when is_list(UnzipPath)->
 1207:             DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1208:             Dir = filename:join([DataDir, "test-zip", "dir-1"]),
 1209:             TestZipOutputDir = filename:join(DataDir, "test-zip-output"),
 1210:             TestZipOutput = filename:join(TestZipOutputDir, "test.zip"),
 1211:             zip:create(TestZipOutput, [Dir]),
 1212:             run_command(UnzipPath, ["-o", TestZipOutput,  "-d", TestZipOutputDir]),
 1213:             {ok, FileContent} = file:read_file(filename:join([TestZipOutputDir, Dir, "file.txt"])),
 1214:             <<"OKOK\n">> = FileContent,
 1215:             ok;
 1216:         _ -> {skip, "Not Unix or unzip program not found"}
 1217:     end.
 1218: 
 1219: run_command(Command, Args) ->
 1220:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn_executable, Command}, [{args, Args}, exit_status]),
 1221:     (fun Reciver() ->
 1222:              receive
 1223:                  {Port,{exit_status,_}} -> ok;
 1224:                  {Port, S} -> io:format("UNZIP: ~p~n", [S]),
 1225:                               Reciver()
 1226:              end
 1227:      end)().
 1228:     
 1229: explicit_file_info(_Config) ->
 1230:     Epoch = {{1980,1,1},{0,0,0}},
 1231:     FileInfo = #file_info{type=regular, size=0, mtime=Epoch},
 1232:     Files = [{"datetime", <<>>, FileInfo},
 1233:              {"seconds", <<>>, FileInfo#file_info{mtime=315532800}}],
 1234:     {ok, _} = zip:zip("", Files, [memory]),
 1235:     ok.
 1236: 
 1237: mode(Config) ->
 1238: 
 1239:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1240:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1241:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1242: 
 1243:     Executable = filename:join(PrivDir,"exec"),
 1244:     file:write_file(Executable, "aaa"),
 1245:     {ok, ExecFI } = file:read_file_info(Executable),
 1246:     ok = file:write_file_info(Executable, ExecFI#file_info{ mode = 8#111 bor 8#400 }),
 1247:     {ok, #file_info{ mode = OrigExecMode }} = file:read_file_info(Executable),
 1248: 
 1249:     Directory = filename:join(PrivDir,"dir"),
 1250:     ok = file:make_dir(Directory),
 1251:     {ok, DirFI } = file:read_file_info(Executable),
 1252:     ok = file:write_file_info(Directory, DirFI#file_info{ mode = 8#111 bor 8#400 }),
 1253:     {ok, #file_info{ mode = OrigDirMode }} = file:read_file_info(Directory),
 1254: 
 1255:     ?assertMatch(
 1256:        {ok, Archive},
 1257:        zip(Config, Archive, "-r", ["dir","exec"], [{cwd, PrivDir},{extra,[extended_timestamp]}])),
 1258: 
 1259:     OrigExecMode777 = OrigExecMode band 8#777,
 1260:     OrigDirMode777 = OrigDirMode band 8#777,
 1261: 
 1262:     ?assertMatch(
 1263:        {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1264:              #zip_file{ name = "dir/", info = #file_info{ mode = OrigDirMode777 }},
 1265:              #zip_file{ name = "exec", info = #file_info{ mode = OrigExecMode777 }} ]},
 1266:        zip:list_dir(Archive)),
 1267: 
 1268:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1269:     ?assertMatch(
 1270:        {ok, ["dir/","exec"]}, unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd,ExtractDir}])),
 1271: 
 1272:     case un_z64(get_value(unzip, Config)) =/= unemzip of
 1273:         true ->
 1274:             {ok,#file_info{ mode = ExecMode }} =
 1275:                 file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir,"exec")),
 1276:             ?assertEqual(ExecMode band 8#777, OrigExecMode777),
 1277: 
 1278:             {ok,#file_info{ mode = DirMode }} =
 1279:                 file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir,"dir")),
 1280:             ?assertEqual(DirMode band 8#777, OrigDirMode777);
 1281:         false ->
 1282:             %% emzip does not support mode
 1283:             ok
 1284:     end,
 1285: 
 1286:     ok.
 1287: 
 1288: %% Test that zip64 local and central headers are respected when unzipping.
 1289: %% The fields in the header that can be 64-bit are:
 1290: %%  * compressed size
 1291: %%  * uncompressed size
 1292: %%  * relative offset
 1293: %%  * starting disk
 1294: %%
 1295: %% As we do not support using multiple disks, we do not test starting disks
 1296: zip64_central_headers() -> [{timetrap, {minutes, 60}}].
 1297: zip64_central_headers(Config) ->
 1298: 
 1299:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1300:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "../archive.zip"),
 1301: 
 1302:     %% Check that ../../large.txt exists and is of correct size
 1303:     {ok, #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } } =
 1304:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt")),
 1305: 
 1306:     %% We very carefully create an archive that should contain all
 1307:     %% different header combinations.
 1308:     %% - uncomp.txt: uncomp size > 4GB
 1309:     %% - uncomp.comp.zip: uncomp and comp size > 4GB
 1310:     %% - offset.txt: offset > 4GB
 1311:     %% - uncomp.offset.txt: uncomp size and offset > 4GB
 1312:     %% - uncomp.comp.offset.zip: uncomp and comp size and offset > 4GB
 1313:     %%
 1314:     %% The archive will be roughly 8 GBs large
 1315: 
 1316:     ok = file:make_link(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt"),
 1317:                         filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.txt")),
 1318:     ok = file:make_link(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt"),
 1319:                         filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.comp.zip")),
 1320:     ok = file:make_link(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../medium.txt"),
 1321:                         filename:join(PrivDir, "offset.txt")),
 1322:     ok = file:make_link(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt"),
 1323:                         filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.offset.txt")),
 1324:     ok = file:make_link(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt"),
 1325:                         filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.comp.offset.zip")),
 1326:     ?assertMatch(
 1327:        {ok, Archive},
 1328:        zip(Config, Archive, "-1",
 1329:            ["uncomp.txt","uncomp.comp.zip","offset.txt",
 1330:             "uncomp.offset.txt","uncomp.comp.offset.zip"],
 1331:            [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1332: 
 1333:     %% Check that list archive works
 1334:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1335:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.txt",
 1336:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } },
 1337:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.comp.zip",
 1338:                      comp_size = 1 bsl 32,
 1339:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } },
 1340:           #zip_file{ name = "offset.txt",
 1341:                      info = #file_info{ size = 4 bsl 20 } },
 1342:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.offset.txt",
 1343:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } },
 1344:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.comp.offset.zip",
 1345:                      comp_size = 1 bsl 32,
 1346:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } }
 1347:          ]} =
 1348:         zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1349:     ok.
 1350: 
 1351: unzip64_central_headers() -> [{timetrap, {minutes, 60}}].
 1352: unzip64_central_headers(Config) ->
 1353: 
 1354:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1355:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1356:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "../../archive.zip"),
 1357:     Large4GB = filename:join(get_value(priv_dir, Config),"large.txt"),
 1358:     Medium4MB = filename:join(get_value(priv_dir, Config), "medium.txt"),
 1359: 
 1360:     %% Test that extraction of each file works
 1361:     lists:map(
 1362:       fun F({Name, Compare}) ->
 1363:               ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1364:               ?assertMatch(
 1365:                  {ok, [Name]},
 1366:                  unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd, ExtractDir},{file_list,[Name]}])),
 1367:               cmp(Compare, filename:join(ExtractDir,Name)),
 1368:               file:del_dir_r(ExtractDir);
 1369:           F(Name) ->
 1370:               F({Name, Large4GB})
 1371:       end, ["uncomp.txt","uncomp.comp.zip",{"offset.txt",Medium4MB},
 1372:             "uncomp.offset.txt","uncomp.comp.offset.zip"]),
 1373: 
 1374:     ok.
 1375: 
 1376: %% Test that zip64 end of central directory are respected when unzipping.
 1377: %% The fields in the header that can be 64-bit are:
 1378: %%   * total number of files > 2 bytes
 1379: %%   * size of central directory > 4 bytes (cannot test as it requires an archive with 8 million files)
 1380: %%   * offset of central directory > 4 bytes (implicitly tested when testing large relative location of header)
 1381: %%
 1382: %% Fields that we don't test as we don't support multiple disks
 1383: %%   * number of disk where end of central directory is > 2 bytes
 1384: %%   * number of disk to find central directory > 2 bytes
 1385: %%   * number central directory entries on this disk > 2 bytes
 1386: zip64_central_directory(Config) ->
 1387: 
 1388:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1389:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "files"),
 1390:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1391: 
 1392:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1393: 
 1394:     %% To test when total number of files > 65535, we create an archive with 66000 entries
 1395:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
 1396:     lists:foreach(
 1397:       fun(I) ->
 1398:               ok = file:write_file(filename:join(Dir, integer_to_list(I)++".txt"),<<0:8>>)
 1399:       end, lists:seq(0, 65600)),
 1400:     ?assertMatch(
 1401:        {ok, Archive},
 1402:        zip(Config, Archive, "-1 -r", ["files"], [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1403: 
 1404:     {ok, Files} = zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1405:     ?assertEqual(65603, length(Files)),
 1406: 
 1407:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1408:     ?assertMatch(
 1409:        {ok, ["files/1.txt","files/65599.txt"]},
 1410:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd, ExtractDir},{file_list,["files/1.txt",
 1411:                                                              "files/65599.txt"]}])),
 1412:     cmp(filename:join(ExtractDir,"files/1.txt"),
 1413:         filename:join(ExtractDir,"files/65599.txt")),
 1414: 
 1415:     ok.
 1416: 
 1417: %% Test basic timestamps, the atime and mtime should be the original
 1418: %% mtime of the file
 1419: basic_timestamp(Config) ->
 1420:     PrivDir =  get_value(pdir, Config),
 1421:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1422:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1423:     Testfile = filename:join(PrivDir, "testfile.txt"),
 1424: 
 1425:     ok = file:write_file(Testfile, "abc"),
 1426:     {ok, OndiskFI = #file_info{ mtime = Mtime }} =
 1427:         file:read_file_info(Testfile),
 1428: 
 1429:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1430:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1431: 
 1432:     %% Create an archive without extended timestamps
 1433:     ?assertMatch(
 1434:        {ok, Archive},
 1435:        zip(Config, Archive, "-X", ["testfile.txt"], [{cwd, PrivDir}, {extra, []}])),
 1436: 
 1437:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1438:           #zip_file{ info = ZipFI = #file_info{ mtime = ZMtime }} ]} =
 1439:         zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1440: 
 1441:     ct:log("on disk: ~p",[OndiskFI]),
 1442:     ct:log("in zip : ~p",[ZipFI]),
 1443:     ct:log("zipinfo:~n~ts",[os:cmd("zipinfo -v "++Archive)]),
 1444: 
 1445:     %% Timestamp in archive is when entry was added to archive
 1446:     %% Need to add 2 to ZMtime as the dos time in zip archives
 1447:     %% are in precise.
 1448:     ?assert(calendar:datetime_to_gregorian_seconds(Mtime) =<
 1449:                 calendar:datetime_to_gregorian_seconds(ZMtime) + 1),
 1450: 
 1451:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1452:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1453: 
 1454:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1455:     ?assertMatch(
 1456:        {ok, ["testfile.txt"]},
 1457:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd,ExtractDir}])),
 1458: 
 1459:     {ok, UnzipFI } =
 1460:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir, "testfile.txt"),[raw]),
 1461: 
 1462: 
 1463:     ct:log("extract: ~p",[UnzipFI]),
 1464: 
 1465:     UnzipMode = un_z64(get_value(unzip, Config)),
 1466: 
 1467:     assert_timestamp(UnzipMode, UnzipFI, ZMtime),
 1468: 
 1469:     ok.
 1470: 
 1471: %% Test extended timestamps, the atime and ctime in the archive are
 1472: %% the atime and ctime when the file is added to the archive.
 1473: extended_timestamp(Config) ->
 1474: 
 1475:     PrivDir =  get_value(pdir, Config),
 1476:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1477:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1478:     Testfile = filename:join(PrivDir, "testfile.txt"),
 1479: 
 1480:     ok = file:write_file(Testfile, "abc"),
 1481:     {ok, OndiskFI = #file_info{ mtime = Mtime }} =
 1482:         file:read_file_info(Testfile),
 1483: 
 1484:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1485:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1486: 
 1487:     ?assertMatch(
 1488:        {ok, Archive},
 1489:        zip(Config, Archive, "", ["testfile.txt"], [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1490: 
 1491:     %% list_dir only reads the central directory header and thus only
 1492:     %% the mtime will be correct here
 1493:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1494:           #zip_file{ info = ZipFI = #file_info{ mtime = ZMtime}} ]} =
 1495:         zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1496: 
 1497:     ct:log("on disk: ~p",[OndiskFI]),
 1498:     ct:log("in zip : ~p",[ZipFI]),
 1499:     ct:log("zipinfo:~n~ts",[os:cmd("zipinfo -v "++Archive)]),
 1500: 
 1501:     ?assertEqual(Mtime, ZMtime),
 1502: 
 1503:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1504:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1505: 
 1506:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1507:     ?assertMatch(
 1508:        {ok, ["testfile.txt"]},
 1509:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd,ExtractDir}])),
 1510: 
 1511:     {ok, UnzipFI } =
 1512:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir, "testfile.txt"),[raw]),
 1513: 
 1514:     ct:log("extract: ~p",[UnzipFI]),
 1515: 
 1516:     UnzipMode = un_z64(get_value(unzip, Config)),
 1517: 
 1518:     assert_timestamp(UnzipMode, UnzipFI, ZMtime ),
 1519: 
 1520:     ok.
 1521: 
 1522: assert_timestamp(unemzip, _FI, _ZMtime) ->
 1523:     %% emzip does not support timestamps
 1524:     ok;
 1525: assert_timestamp(_, #file_info{ atime = UnZAtime, mtime = UnZMtime, ctime = UnZCtime }, ZMtime) ->
 1526: 
 1527:     ?assertEqual(ZMtime, UnZMtime),
 1528: 
 1529:     %% both atime and ctime behave very differently on different platforms, so it is rather hard to test.
 1530:     %% atime is sometimes set to ctime for unknown reasons, and sometimes set to 1970...
 1531:     ?assert(UnZAtime =:= UnZMtime orelse UnZAtime =:= UnZCtime orelse UnZAtime =:= {{1970,1,1},{1,0,0}}),
 1532: 
 1533:     %% On windows the ctime and mtime are the same so
 1534:     %% we cannot compare them.
 1535:     [?assert(UnZMtime < UnZCtime) || os:type() =/= {win32,nt}],
 1536: 
 1537:     ok.
 1538: 
 1539: uid_gid(Config) ->
 1540: 
 1541:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1542:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1543:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1544:     Testfile = filename:join(PrivDir, "testfile.txt"),
 1545: 
 1546:     ok = file:write_file(Testfile, "abc"),
 1547:     {ok, OndiskFI = #file_info{ gid = GID, uid = UID }} =
 1548:         file:read_file_info(Testfile),
 1549: 
 1550:     ?assertMatch(
 1551:        {ok, Archive},
 1552:        zip(Config, Archive, "", ["testfile.txt"], [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1553: 
 1554:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1555:           #zip_file{ info = ZipFI = #file_info{ gid = ZGID, uid = ZUID }} ]} =
 1556:         zip:list_dir(Archive,[{extra, [uid_gid]}]),
 1557: 
 1558:     ct:log("on disk: ~p",[OndiskFI]),
 1559:     ct:log("in zip : ~p",[ZipFI]),
 1560: 
 1561:     ?assertEqual(UID, ZUID),
 1562:     ?assertEqual(GID, ZGID),
 1563: 
 1564:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1565:     ?assertMatch(
 1566:        {ok, ["testfile.txt"]},
 1567:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd, ExtractDir},{extra,[uid_gid]}])),
 1568: 
 1569:     {ok,#file_info{ gid = ExZGID, uid = ExZUID }} =
 1570:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir,"testfile.txt")),
 1571: 
 1572:     case un_z64(get_value(unzip, Config)) =/= unemzip of
 1573:         true ->
 1574:             ?assertEqual(UID, ExZUID),
 1575:             ?assertEqual(GID, ExZGID);
 1576:         _ ->
 1577:             %% emzip does not support uid_gid
 1578:             ok
 1579:     end,
 1580: 
 1581:     ok.
 1582: 
 1583: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1584: %%% Generic zip interface
 1585: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1586: zip(Config, Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) when is_list(Config) ->
 1587:     zip(get_value(zip, Config),
 1588:         Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts);
 1589: zip(z64_zip, Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1590:     zip(zip, Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts);
 1591: zip(zip, Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1592:     cmd("cd "++get_value(cwd, Opts)++" && "
 1593:         "zip "++ZipOpts++" "++Archive++" "++lists:join($ ,Filelist)),
 1594:     {ok, Archive};
 1595: zip(z64_ezip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1596:     zip(ezip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts);
 1597: zip(ezip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1598:     ct:log("Creating zip:zip(~p,~n~p,~n~p)",[Archive, Filelist, Opts]),
 1599:     zip:zip(Archive, Filelist, Opts);
 1600: zip(z64_emzip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1601:     %% Run in peer node so that memory issues don't crash test node
 1602:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{ args => emzip_peer_args() }),
 1603:     try
 1604:         erpc:call(
 1605:           Node,
 1606:           fun() ->
 1607:             ?MODULE:zip(emzip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts)
 1608:           end)
 1609:     after
 1610:         catch peer:stop(Peer)
 1611:     end;
 1612: zip(emzip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1613:     ct:log("Creating emzip ~ts",[Archive]),
 1614:     Cwd = get_value(cwd, Opts),
 1615: 
 1616:     
 1617:     %% For this not to use a huge amount of memory we re-use
 1618:     %% the binary for files that are the same size as those are the same file.
 1619:     %% This cuts memory usage from ~16GB to ~4GB.
 1620: 
 1621:     {Files,_Cache} =
 1622:         lists:mapfoldl(
 1623:         fun F(Fn, Cache) ->
 1624:                 AbsFn = filename:join(Cwd, Fn),
 1625:                 {ok, Fi} = file:read_file_info(AbsFn),
 1626:                 CacheKey = {Fi#file_info.type, Fi#file_info.size},
 1627:                 {SubDirFiles, NewCache} =
 1628:                     if Fi#file_info.type == directory ->
 1629:                             {ok, Files} = file:list_dir(AbsFn),
 1630:                             lists:mapfoldl(F, Cache#{ CacheKey => <<>> },
 1631:                                             [filename:join(Fn, DirFn) || DirFn <- Files]);
 1632:                         Fi#file_info.type == regular ->
 1633:                             {[],
 1634:                                 case maps:find(CacheKey, Cache) of
 1635:                                     {ok, _} -> Cache;
 1636:                                     error ->
 1637:                                         {ok, Data} = read_file(
 1638:                                                     file:open(AbsFn, [read, raw, binary]),
 1639:                                                     Fi#file_info.size),
 1640:                                         Cache#{ CacheKey => Data }
 1641:                                 end}
 1642:                     end,
 1643:                 {[{Fn, maps:get(CacheKey, NewCache), Fi}|SubDirFiles], NewCache}
 1644:         end,  #{}, Filelist),
 1645:     zip:zip(Archive, lists:flatten(Files), proplists:delete(cwd,Opts)).
 1646: 
 1647: %% Special read_file that works on windows on > 4 GB files
 1648: read_file({ok, D}, Size) ->
 1649:     Bin = iolist_to_binary(read_file(D, Size)),
 1650:     erlang:garbage_collect(), %% Do a GC to get rid of all intermediate binaries
 1651:     {ok, Bin};
 1652: read_file({error, _} = E, _Size) ->
 1653:     E;
 1654: read_file(eof = E, _Size) ->
 1655:     E;
 1656: read_file(D, 0) ->
 1657:     file:close(D),
 1658:     [];
 1659: read_file(D, Size) ->
 1660:     {ok, B} = file:read(D, min(1 bsl 30, Size)),
 1661:     [B | read_file(D, Size - byte_size(B))].
 1662: 
 1663: unzip(Config, Archive, Opts) when is_list(Config) ->
 1664:     unzip(get_value(unzip, Config), Archive, Opts);
 1665: unzip(z64_unzip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1666:     unzip(unzip, Archive, Opts);
 1667: unzip(unzip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1668:     UidGid = [" -X " || lists:member(uid_gid, get_value(extra, Opts, []))],
 1669:     Files = lists:join($ , get_value(file_list, Opts, [])),
 1670:     Res = cmd("cd "++get_value(cwd, Opts)++" && "
 1671:               "unzip "++UidGid++" "++Archive++" "++Files),
 1672:     {ok, lists:sort(
 1673:            lists:flatmap(
 1674:              fun(Ln) ->
 1675:                      case re:run(Ln, ~B'\s+[a-z]+: ([^\s]+)', [{capture,all_but_first,list},unicode]) of
 1676:                          nomatch -> [];
 1677:                          {match,Match} -> Match
 1678:                      end
 1679:              end,string:split(Res,"\n",all)))};
 1680: unzip(z64_unezip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1681:     unzip(unezip, Archive, Opts);
 1682: unzip(unezip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1683:     Cwd = get_value(cwd, Opts) ++ "/",
 1684:     {ok, Files} = zip:unzip(Archive, Opts),
 1685:     {ok, lists:sort([F -- Cwd || F <- Files])};
 1686: unzip(z64_unemzip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1687:     %% Run in peer node so that memory issues don't crash test node
 1688:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{ args => emzip_peer_args() }),
 1689:     try
 1690:       erpc:call(
 1691:         Node,
 1692:         fun() ->
 1693:             unzip(unemzip, Archive, Opts)
 1694:         end)
 1695:     after
 1696:         catch peer:stop(Peer)
 1697:     end;
 1698: unzip(unemzip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1699:     Cwd = get_value(cwd, Opts) ++ "/",
 1700:     
 1701:     {ok, Files} = zip:unzip(Archive, [memory | Opts]),
 1702:     {ok, lists:sort(
 1703:             [begin
 1704:                 case lists:last(F) of
 1705:                     $/ ->
 1706:                         filelib:ensure_path(F);
 1707:                     _ ->
 1708:                         filelib:ensure_dir(F),
 1709:                         file:write_file(F, B)
 1710:                 end,
 1711:                 F -- Cwd
 1712:             end || {F, B} <- Files])}.
 1713: 
 1714: emzip_peer_args() ->
 1715:     8 = erlang:system_info(wordsize),%% Supercarrier only supported on 64-bit
 1716:     ["+MMscs",integer_to_list(?EMZIP64_MEM_USAGE div (1024 * 1024))].
 1717: 
 1718: cmp(Source, Target) ->
 1719:     {ok, SrcInfo} = file:read_file_info(Source),
 1720:     {ok, TgtInfo} = file:read_file_info(Target),
 1721:     ?assertEqual(SrcInfo#file_info.size, TgtInfo#file_info.size),
 1722:     ?assertEqual(SrcInfo#file_info.mode, TgtInfo#file_info.mode),
 1723: 
 1724:     {ok, Src} = file:open(Source, [read, binary]),
 1725:     {ok, Tgt} = file:open(Target, [read, binary]),
 1726: 
 1727:     cmp(Src, Tgt, 0),
 1728: 
 1729:     file:close(Src),
 1730:     file:close(Tgt).
 1731: 
 1732: %% Check if first 100 MB are the same
 1733: cmp(Src, Tgt, Pos) when Pos < 100 bsl 20 ->
 1734:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1735:     case {file:read(Src, 20 bsl 20), file:read(Tgt, 20 bsl 20)} of
 1736:         {{ok, Data}, {ok, Data}} ->
 1737:             cmp(Src, Tgt, Pos + 20 bsl 20);
 1738:         {E, E} ->
 1739:             ok
 1740:     end;
 1741: cmp(_Src, _Tgt, _) ->
 1742:     ok.
 1743: 
 1744: cmd(Cmd) ->
 1745:     Res = os:cmd(Cmd),
 1746:     ct:log("Cmd: ~ts~nRes: ~ts~n",[Cmd, Res]),
 1747:     Res.
 1748: 
 1749: disc_free(Path) ->
 1750:     Data = disksup:get_disk_data(),
 1751: 
 1752:     %% What partitions could Data be mounted on?
 1753:     Partitions =
 1754:         [D || {P, _Tot, _Perc}=D <- Data,
 1755:          lists:prefix(filename:nativename(P), filename:nativename(Path))],
 1756: 
 1757:     %% Sorting in descending order places the partition with the most specific
 1758:     %% path first.
 1759:     case lists:sort(fun erlang:'>='/2, Partitions) of
 1760:         [{_,Tot, Perc} | _] -> round(Tot * (1-(Perc/100)));
 1761:         [] -> error
 1762:     end.
 1763: 
 1764: memsize() ->
 1765:     case proplists:get_value(available_memory, memsup:get_system_memory_data()) of
 1766:         undefined ->
 1767:             {Tot,_Used,_}  = memsup:get_memory_data(),
 1768:             Tot;
 1769:         Available ->
 1770:             Available
 1771:     end.
